mdRecord.dcterms:title: On the Tow-path -- A Halt
mdRecord.dcterms:description: American Impressionist Theodore Robinson was born in Irasburg, Vermont and studied at the National Academy of Design, and later at the Art Students League. He made a number of visits to France and became a close friend of French Impressionist painter Claude Monet. Best known for his landscape paintings, as well ad genre paintings of village and farm life, Robinson had numerous exhibitions both abroad and in the United States.
